We're working on more stories right now

                                            By 
                                                    Issac J. Bailey


                                            By 
                                                    David Makovsky


                                            By 
                                                    Barney Frank


                                            By 
Benjamin Wofford


                AP Photo

                        'We're not going to bottle up the process so much and predetermine the outcome of everything around here,' the new speaker says.

            By 
Jake Sherman

11/05/15 01:44 PM EST
Speaker Paul Ryan said the House will be so freewheeling under his direction that leaders might put bills on the floor that will fail. 
"I'm going to tell you bills will come up that may not pass," Ryan (R-Wis.) told reporters Thursday. "We're not going to bottle up the process so much and predetermine the outcome of everything around here. I want the House to work its will. I think that's the way the founders envisioned it to work. And so some things will pass, and some things won't, and we're going to let that happen."
Story Continued Below
Ryan did allow a wide range of amendments on the Senate's highway bill this week, which was received as a hopeful sign by lawmakers yearning for more power. Traditionally, it's an embarrassment for leadership if a bill fails on the House floor.
"The way I am trying to do this job is the way I always thought it should have been done and that is to make this a more open process," Ryan said. "So that every citizen of this country through their elected representatives has the opportunity to make a difference. That is the people's House. This is the branch of government closest to the people.
"So I wanted to have a process that is more open, more inclusive, more deliberative, more participatory and that's what we're trying to do."
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: 'We're not going to bottle up the process so much and predetermine the outcome of everything around here,' the new speaker says.
title: Ryan: I'm OK with bills failing
